comments.text:
You can't go faster than the speed of light for a few reasons. For one, it 
would violate the principle of relativity, which Galileo purposed and 
Einstein picked up to form his theory of relativity. Second, and I may be 
mistaken on this, I'm pretty sure electrons communicate using photons 
between them and the nucleus of the atom itself.﻿

comments.author: John Robenault

comments.text:
+John Robenault This is gonna sound really weird but here it goes. Time and 
space are infinite. While you only exist in the now, you dont exist in even 
the next second or the past second, at least not in THIS exact time lapse. 
Bare with me, I know its hard to understand. For example, I am 22. I 
techincally have lived for 22 years, yet I no longer exist in the past, and 
as I'm writing this sentence I do not even exist before I type each letter. 
WE have no future or past really, but time does. All time traveling would 
do is open portals to alternate time realities of either our past life or 
future. In other words, if you had been in a car accident a year ago, if 
you time traveled back to a year, you wouldnt neccessarily be in that car 
accident. Who knows, in THAT timeline you might have died before or never 
been born at all. Same with the future. We all want to see our future, but 
seeing us in the future would only be a glimpse into an alternate reality 
of our lives. And, contrary to popular belief, if you fcked something up in 
your past when you time traveled, it wouldnt affect your present life cause 
your present life is just that...its the PRESENT. Past does not exist in 
this realm. Debate is out on whether or not humans could time travel to a 
period from before they were born. Question is we dont know and wont till 
we try it. Who knows, maybe in another realm you were born 500 years ago. 
If not, some believe we wouldnt even be able to travel to time frames like 
that. This proves that we dont control time, time controls us. If we try to 
travel into an alternate reality where we arent yet born, we simply wont be 
able to go there. Likweise, if we tried to travel to a future where we were 
already dead, we couldnt reach it. But the good thing is none of this would 
affect the life you live NOW, according to modern theories. The butterfly 
effect is no longer accepted by many experts because of this. So in essence 
we always think that a tie machine would allow us to control time. Wrong, 
it allows us to control portals to certain time periods. If we dont exist 
in a certain time frame in a certain portal, one could not travel there. 
This is why many time travel experts now believe portals to available time 
frames are now more important than creating time machines. What could is 
making a time machine if we couldnt travel through it? Some are even saying 
time machines are going to have to be personalized to each user. We are 
going to have to figure out which time portals you exist in in the past and 
future and then make a time machine that can take you there, but only you 
since it would just be your past and future. Point is, we are further from 
time traveling than we thought. Alternate time dimensions need to be 
understood and studied more. I wouldnt expect it to happen in our lifetime. 
But once it does happen, theoretically you will only be able to go into 
YOUR past and your future, not someone else's or the worlds in general. 
Good thing is since time is infiitie, its highly likely you exist in a 
mulitple time periods. In fact, since time is infinite, you are too really. 
But time is split up into portals and sectors so we would have to find out 
where you exist in certain pasts and futures.

The faster you travel, the faster time goes. A study showed that clocks on 
moving planes ticked about 1 millisecond faster than the clocks on the 
ground. So, if you traveled into space in a rocket and went close to the 
speed of light for, let's say, 2 months, WAY more than 2 months would have 
passed on Earth.﻿
